FuncDef:
The ipv6 route-static default-preference command sets the default priority for IPv6 static routes.
The undo ipv6 route-static default-preference command restores the default priority of IPv6 static routes. The ipv6 route-static default-preference command sets the default priority for IPv6 static routes. The undo ipv6 route-static default-preference command restores the default priority of IPv6 static routes. By default, the default priority of static routes is 60. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the default priority for IPv6 static routes.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

ExtraInfo: You can change the status of a route by changing its priority. To change the default priority of new IPv6 static routes, run the ipv6 route-static default-preference command.
